content.description: Climb the right side of the arete using thin plates and edges, up to a large flat shelf at about 15 feet. Execute an exposed and attention grabbing mantel, hand-foot match, and reach for the lip. So, so good.
content.protection: pads, possibly a spotter on the rock near the base.
content.location: This problem is located on the tall Meadow 3 boulder, located about 20 meters behind the main Meadows boulder. On the left arete, while facing the  steepest (scooped) face of the boulder.

content.description: Climb up the low angle rounded arete on grainy sloping edges above a small cluster of joshua trees. Also the downclimb...
content.protection: difficult to pad due to the joshua trees
content.location: Located on the Meadows 3 boulder, on the Northeast arete.

content.description: One big move to a mantle crux.
content.location: Same start as Slapslope except go stright up. Far left side of the west face.

content.description: Start at the big sidepull flake, move up left past a black xeno/fin, finishing higher left on slopers.
content.location: Located on the Meadows 1 boulder, the smaller block just behind the main meadows boulder. (To the left of the Mulligan and Browning slab problems)

content.description: Climb up the thin dike, following a trail of small black protrusions.
content.location: Located on the Meadows 3 boulder, the obvious black dike on the right side of the steep scooped face.

content.description:
SDS at a low shelf and work up and slightly right on horizontals to the crux move, a long reach to a two-handed slot, before making another reach and and mantling over the sloping top. FYI - unlike the guidebook description the crux is down low unless you're mantelly-challenged.

Short but really fun climbing on mostly jugs with a definite crux.
content.location: Center of the west face where the rock starts to become undercut.

content.description: Start sitting at a curving rail and head directly into the crux which is possible via two ways - either crimp a narrow slot before firing up for a horizontal, or go big and launch directly for it, and then top out with an easy mantel.
content.location: Left side of the west face.

content.description:
A fun compression variation to Raspberry. This looked like the more obvious line to me when I first saw the boulder and it may have already been climbed. It isn't listed in the 2012 guidebook but the holds underneath the roof were ticked when I did it.

Start as for Raspberry but instead of matching the jug, move left to a crimp rail, staying underneath the roof. Bump the right hand and set up for a big left-hand move out to a flat sloper. From there, finish up the arete on good holds.

Video:

youtube.com/watch?v=prJ3zyuâ€¦

This somewhat unique problem starts sitting under a low roof with hands matched on a good undercling. Make a long reach from the undercling to a huge bucket, match again and then grab one more decent hold before confronting the crux slopers on your way to some jugs and the end of the difficulties.

The brief crux consists of a few very sloping pulls and is probably best done when temperatures are cooler to ensure success.
content.protection: pads, a spotter is nice at the crux

content.description:
This problem contrasts nicely with the others on this boulder - delicate and technical.

Start left of center.   Get established and move to the middle of the slabby wall and continue more or less direct to the top.
content.location: Located on the center of the North face

content.description:
Sit start at the lowest set of holds on the left of the face.    Traverse the wall rightwards passing first

Slapslope

, then

Sloper Safari

to join

Meadows Traverse

which is followed to the finish.

The perfect problem to burn out on at the end of the day.   Big holds, big moves and long.
content.location: Left to right traverse of the NW face

content.description:
Sit start as per

Sloper Safari

(V4) at a low shelf and work up and right on horizontal slashes (staying low where

Sloper Safari

heads up) to match on a curved thin hold (crux) and then make a long reach/throw for the upper horizontal which is traversed right a ways before manteling over the top.
content.protection: Pad, a spotter might be nice at the crux
content.location: Center of the west face where the rock starts to become undercut.

content.description:
Sit start under the overhang with hands on two good holds.    Make a long reach to the good slot then hold the swing as you get established below the next long move.

Make another long move to the good break, then finish rightwards and mantel.
Climb up the middle of the scooped face on grainy (choss) edges, above an uneven rocky landing.
content.protection: multiple pads, but probably best not to fall from the top
content.location: Located on the Meadows 3 boulder, between Young Plates and the Thin Black Dike.

content.description: Climb up the slab on the left side of the green lichen streak.
content.location: Northeast side of the main meadows boulder
